definitions.sensetop: commend somebody/something (for something/for doing something)commend somebody/something (on something/on doing something)

examples.text: She was commended on her handling of the situation.
His designs were **highly commended** by the judges *(= they did not get a prize but they were especially praised)*.

phrases: something has little, much, nothing, etc. to commend it

examples.text: She is an excellent worker and I commend her to you without reservation.
The movie **has little to commend it** *(= it has few good qualities)*.
The proposed site has much to commend it.
She said she would commend the proposal to the Board.

definitions.definition: if something commends itself to somebody, they approve of it

examples.text: His outspoken behaviour did not commend itself to his colleagues.

definitions.definition: to give somebody/something to somebody in order to be taken care of

examples.text: We commend her soul to God.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Latin commendare, from com- (expressing intensive force) + mandare ‘commit, entrust’. Compare with command.
